Hannegan Roseberry is with Mia Lopp at Community Montessori.
August 6 at 4:56 PM · Instagram ·

The sign is hung and the CASA dei Curiosity is open for business! While it is bittersweet that the opening has arrived during a global pandemic that complicates our ability to initially create theatre in the way we’d hoped, I am inspired and hopeful about the journey ahead. If you scroll through the pics, you’ll see a beautiful bench that was gifted to us by some graduating seniors. This program was built by them and those that came before them. It was the first thing we carried into the new space. The image of the phoenix rising will serve as a guidepost for us as we forge a new beginning in our second decade as a theatre program at Community Montessori. I am fllled with gratitude and can’t wait to work with the learners to fill this space with laughter, music, and storytelling. @ Community Montessori

Hannegan Roseberry is with Martin French and 3 others at Community Montessori.
September 20, 2019 at 6:34 PM · Instagram ·

Dreaming about and planning for the CASA dei Curiosity, the new construction at Community Montessori! We’re breaking ground in the coming month and within the year we’ll have a beautiful new space in which to do large-scale creative endeavors, exhibitions, and theatre productions! The CM Players theatre program began 10 years ago and has grown exponentially into a program that helps teens to become leaders and collaborators (while also putting on terrific shows). My head and heart still can’t believe we are going to have this beautiful new space to create art in. Stay tuned for the journey ahead! Here are some of my amazing teens working on spray painting out the footprint of the new building so the learners can picture what is to come. A big thanks to Martin French for helping us map it out today! #casadeicuriosity #communitymontessori @ Community Montessori

Support our blood drive @ Community Montessori on Thursday February 14th from 11 AM – 3 PM! The American Red Cross is currently facing a blood shortage. Blood products are perishable and the only source of lifesaving blood is volunteer blood donors. Therefore, any disruptions to donations – from declines due to holiday travel, severe weather, and even widespread flu – can lead to a shortage and cause delays in essential medical care.

Schedule today! At https://www.redcrossblood.org/ and enter sponsor code: CMNEWALBANY.

Katie Keller is at Community Montessori.
August 27, 2018 at 5:41 PM · New Albany, IN ·

“It is high time that movement came to be regarded from a new point of view in educational theory. Especially in childhood, we misunderstand its nature, and a number of mistaken ideas make us think of it as something less noble than it actually is. As part of school life, which gives priority to the intellect, the role of movement has always been sadly neglected. When accepted there at all, it has always been under the heading of ‘exercise’ , ‘physical education ’, or ‘games’. But this is to overlook its close connection with the developing mind.” -Maria Montessori ❤️

post_text: A thoughtful reflection and photos from Danielle Manzo, one of our adolescent teachers at CM, about her summer residency this year. Thanks for sharing, Danielle!
shared_text:
Danielle Manzo added 25 new photos to the album: 2018 CGMS Summer Field Experience: Leadership Through Stewardship — with Goat Milk Stuff and Zack Windell at Bernheim Arboretum and Research Forest.
July 20, 2018 at 8:54 AM · Clermont, KY ·

On July 19th our summer residency ventured out to Goat Milk Stuff Farm in Scottsburg, Indiana and Bernheim Arboretum and Research Forest in Kentucky. Our goal was to see how leadership could be seen through stewardship.

I was surprised by how much precision is involved in both raising goats at Goat Milk Stuff and running a sustainable cafe at Bernheim. It takes a lot of dedicated people to continuously brainstorm, create, and reflect in order to create something that can continue feeding itself into the future. Once again, the scientific method is at work.

There isn’t just a thought of stewardship to the community, but also to the environment. I was inspired by what I saw because it makes all of this feel a little more realistic. I can do this too. If I can do this, then I can pass that same thought onto the teens that I teach, which is what is starting to move me forward.

**For those of you reading this on Facebook land, this is a project for my residency. Enjoy!
